name: updateEnergyCost
description:
You need to provide a Device ID:
- use the hardware/groups service to get all available group ID.

If the ID is "global", then the group being updated is the GlobalSummary.

body.description: The values you wish to assign.

$ul: **co2Emission**: The CO<sub>2</sub> emissions for all devices. This value can be updated by users with sufficient permissions.
**co2EmissionUnit**: The unit in which the CO<sub>2</sub> emission is being expressed.
**editable**: If true, indicates that you do not have sufficient rights to update the global settings. However, you may still have sufficient rights to update a specific group's setting.
**energyCost**: The electricity rate for all devices. This value can be updated by users with sufficient permissions.
**energyCostUnit**: The unit in which the electricity rate is being expressed.
**groupNameFilter**: Regular expression used to filter the groups for which the power consumption will be reported.

**heatingMargin**: The lowest heating margin among the heating margins of all the devices.
Note:This field will only be present if a value could be found.

**heatingMarginCoverage**: The percentage of devices whose heating margin could be found.
Note:This field will only be present if a value could be found.

**heatingMarginDeviceName**: The name of the device having the lowest heating margin.
Note:This field will only be present if a value could be found.

**heatingMarginDeviceUrl**: The link to the details of the device having the lowest heating margin.
Note:This field will only be present if a value could be found.
**heatingMarginUnit**: The unit in which the heating margin is being expressed.
**id**: The ID of the global summary (this ID will always be "global").
**totalPowerConsumption**: The total power consumption of all the devices.
**totalPowerConsumptionUnit**: The unit in which the total power consumption is being expressed.
**updateTimestamp**: The data collection time (as an Epoch time, in seconds).
**code**: The error's business identifier.
**date**: The timestamp of the error.
**message**: The error message.
**code**: The error's business identifier.
**date**: The timestamp of the error.
**message**: The error message.
